instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 no green light
threads.message:
Pp3v42 3.4v
Smc_bc_acok and acok_vcc  3.3v
Adapter_sense 3v
Smc_reset_l 3.4v 
Board looks pretty clean
Resistance to ground on pp3v42_g3h 8.9k ohm, i have tried changing smc 3 times, but i don’t know if its the smc or another problem..

threads.title: 820-2879 no green light
threads.message:
Dc in board is known good
Does dead mcp can cause this ?

threads.title: 820-2879 no green light
threads.message:
Post all U6900 voltages.
Did you check continuity from U6900 to SMC and central pin of Magsafe?

threads.title: 820-2879 no green light
threads.message:
U6900 pin 1 : 3.3v
4 : 3.3v
5 : 3.3v
Continuity on Pin 5 j6900 to u6900 pin 5 is good
Continuity on u6900 pin 5 to ball 96 of smc is good too

threads.title: 820-2879 no green light
threads.message:
"Continuity on Pin 5 j6900 to u6900 pin 5 is good "
To the central pin of Magsafe, in the DCIN board...

threads.title: 820-2879 no green light
threads.message: continuity is good from u6900 pin 5 to magsafe center on the dc in board

threads.title: 820-2879 no green light
threads.message:
Try another charger, origi nal.
If still no light, bad SMC, or solders; if DCIN board is really good.

BTW, exact PPBUS_G3H voltage?
